2019-04-14T07:58:25Z: Here's our comprehensive report from F1's 1000th race. Thanks for joining us for coverage of the Chinese Grand Prix this weekend, and keep an eye out for all the post-race reaction throughout the day on Autosport and Motorsport.com. We'll be back in a fortnight for live updates from the Azerbaijan GP - see you then. Chinese Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton beats Valtteri Bottas to winLewis Hamilton won a processional 2019 Chinese Grand Prix for the Mercedes Formula 1 team ahead of team-mate Valtteri Bottas as Ferrari's challenge faded with a weak opening stint
2019-04-14T07:48:13Z: Outside the points: 11 Grosjean; 12 Stroll; 13 Magnussen; 14 Sainz; 15 Giovinazzi; 16 Russell; 17 Kubica
2019-04-14T07:47:49Z: Result: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Vettel; 4 Verstappen; 5 Leclerc; 6 Gasly; 7 Ricciardo; 8 Perez; 9 Raikkonen; 10 Albon
2019-04-14T07:47:24Z: Ricciardo is seventh and best of the rest ahead of Perez, Raikkonen and, a bit further back, Albon - who holds off Grosjean for the final point.
2019-04-14T07:46:43Z: Vettel finishes 13.7s off the lead in third, with Verstappen staying 3.7s clear of Leclerc for fourth.
2019-04-14T07:46:23Z: Hamilton comes through to win the Chinese GP by 6.6s over Bottas, as Mercedes starts 2019 with a third one-two in three races.
2019-04-14T07:45:57Z: But a great final sector from Gasly means he does grab fastest lap after all! A 1m34.742s takes it off Vettel by a tenth.
2019-04-14T07:45:24Z: Gasly is setting personal best sector times, but not matching Vettel's fastest lap - the point looks like it'll stay with Ferrari.
2019-04-14T07:45:01Z: Hamilton leads Bottas by 6.7s as they begin the final lap of F1's 1000th GP. Which will not rank among its top 500 in terms of interesting stuff happening.
2019-04-14T07:44:36Z: Red Bull left it late enough that no one else can come in for fresh tyres and take fastest lap back if Gasly does manage to grab it.
2019-04-14T07:43:55Z: Grosjean had DRS on the back straight, but so did Albon - who was tucked up behind the Williams of Kubica.
2019-04-14T07:43:26Z: Albon is still holding off the Haas of Grosjean, who is half a second behind.
2019-04-14T07:43:10Z: Leclerc is catching Verstappen faster now - 1.4s on the last lap - but they only have two laps left and the gap is still 5.4s.
2019-04-14T07:42:39Z: Gasly won't lose sixth place because he was half a minute clear of Ricciardo, so this looks like a bold effort to grab fastest lap. He's taken on softs.
2019-04-14T07:42:12Z: Gasly brings his Red Bull back into the pits...
2019-04-14T07:40:59Z: Norris's tricky Chinese GP comes to an early end, as his McLaren is wheeled back into the garage.
2019-04-14T07:39:44Z: Slightly further back, Grosjean is within a second of Albon in the fight for the final point.
2019-04-14T07:39:05Z: Perez is now 1.8s behind Ricciardo, while Raikkonen has dropped 4s off the back of the Racing Point.
2019-04-14T07:38:40Z: Though Leclerc is catching Verstappen still, the rate isn't enough - 9.3s between them in the battle for fourth, with five laps to go.
2019-04-14T07:38:07Z: Leclerc tells Ferrari he's having a gearshift problem. He's still taken another half a second off Verstappen on that lap.
2019-04-14T07:37:37Z: Lead group gaps on lap 50: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +6.8s; 3 Vettel +12.3s; 4 Verstappen +23.3s; 5 Leclerc +32.8s; 6 Gasly +1m03.2s
2019-04-14T07:35:34Z: Grosean has started to find some pace and is 3.2s behind Albon, although that was assisted by Albon moving aside to let a Ferrari through. The Toro Rosso's hards are 29 laps old.
2019-04-14T07:34:29Z: Leclerc takes a second off Verstappen on his last lap, but remains 10.5s behind with seven laps left.
2019-04-14T07:32:13Z: Raikkonen remains in Perez's draft, but the Racing Point is proving slippery enough for the time being. Raikkonen then has a twitch at Turn 3 for good measure.
2019-04-14T07:30:41Z: Magnussen is told he'll have a chance at the end of scoring a point. That seems tricky to imagine, though, given he's 8s behind team-mate Grosjean (who in turn is 9s behind Albon).
2019-04-14T07:30:31Z: Leclerc's next lap isn't so great - he only takes six tenths out of Verstappen, and that won't be enough.
2019-04-14T07:29:28Z: Much better from Leclerc that time - he's within 0.026s of Vettel's fastest lap mark, and he takes 1.3s out of the gap to Verstappen too. The fifth-placed Ferrari is now 12.8s behind the Red Bull with 11 laps left.
2019-04-14T07:29:07Z: Stroll has come in for a second stop and rejoins in 13th on softs.
2019-04-14T07:28:46Z: Hamilton has increased his lead over Bottas to 7.2s.
2019-04-14T07:28:37Z: Raikkonen has made some time in the fight for Class B honours. He's within DRS range of Perez, who is eighth and still 1.5s behind Ricciardo.
2019-04-14T07:28:19Z: Leclerc now does the fastest middle sector of anyone all day so far.
2019-04-14T07:28:02Z: Leclerc's not in fastest lap range yet - he does his best of the day so far but it's 0.9s off what Vettel achieved earlier.
2019-04-14T07:26:45Z: Lead gaps on lap 43: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +7.7s; 3 Vettel +11.5s; 4 Verstappen +22.4s; 5 Leclerc +36.5s; 6 Gasly +57.1s
2019-04-14T07:26:18Z: Toro Rosso wheels Kvyat back into the garage to bring what has been a pretty disappointing race for the Russian to an early end.
2019-04-14T07:26:14Z: One of the Ferrari tyre changers stumbled and fell a little - it looks from the replay like that might've prompted Leclerc to lift in case there was a bigger problem.
2019-04-14T07:25:27Z: Leclerc makes an awkward getaway from his stop, appearing to back off as he pulls away. He rejoins on new mediums, 15s behind Verstappen in fifth with 14 laps to go.
2019-04-14T07:23:38Z: Vettel easily passes Leclerc for third, and Leclerc now pits.
2019-04-14T07:23:31Z: Midfield order with 15 laps to go: 7 Ricciardo; 8 Perez; 9 Raikkonen; 10 Albon; 11 Stroll; 12 Grosjean; 13 Magnussen; 14 Giovinazzi; 15 Sainz; 16 Kvyat; 17 Russell; 18 Kubica; 19 Norris
2019-04-14T07:21:33Z: Fifth-placed Verstappen is also lapping nearly 2s faster than Leclerc. He's 12.3s behind the Ferrari with 15 laps left.
2019-04-14T07:21:00Z: Unsurprisingly Vettel is rapidly catching Leclerc, with the gap between the Ferrari on old hard tyres and the Ferrari on new mediums now under 2s.
2019-04-14T07:20:21Z: Gasly makes a second pitstop too, and continues in his lonely sixth place with a new set of medium tyres.
2019-04-14T07:19:52Z: Bottas is 6.3s behind leader Hamilton after losing that time battling with Leclerc.
2019-04-14T07:19:32Z: There are 17 laps to go, and if Leclerc joins everyone else in switching to a two-stopper anytime soon he'll drop back behind Verstappen into fifth. He'll probably have a good shot at catching the Red Bull again, but  will Ferrari be better off just leaving Leclerc out and getting him to let Vettel through?
2019-04-14T07:18:23Z: But on the back straight there's nothing Leclerc can do this time, and Bottas is into second.
2019-04-14T07:18:10Z: Leclerc continues to work hard to hold Bottas back - which is also helping Vettel gain on both of them.
2019-04-14T07:17:41Z: Leclerc defending against Bottas also stopped Bottas taking the fastest lap point back from Vettel - the Mercedes was well on course to do so until encountering the Ferrari on its alternative strategy.
2019-04-14T07:17:34Z: At the head of the midfield order, Perez is edging closer to getting DRS off the back of seventh-placed Ricciardo.
2019-04-14T07:17:03Z: Bottas attacks Leclerc for second - the Ferrari hogs the inside line into the hairpin and keeps the place despite being on much older tyres.
2019-04-14T07:16:26Z: Bottas is massively quicker than Hamilton on this attack lap, but he may well catch Leclerc at the end of it.
2019-04-14T07:16:01Z: Expect the Mercedes to attack for fastest lap now on their new tyres - they both set purple final sectors on their out-lap...
2019-04-14T07:15:59Z: Back in the midfield, Grosjean has also been in for a second stop to switch back to the mediums. He's 12th, 18s behind Stroll but ahead of team-mate Magnussen.
2019-04-14T07:15:38Z: Vettel grabs fastest lap with a 1m34.836s, two seconds quicker than the previous mark that Bottas held.
2019-04-14T07:14:56Z: Lead gaps now: 1 Hamilton; 2 Leclerc +2.1s; 3 Bottas +5.4s; 4 Vettel +9.6s; 5 Verstappen +19.5s; 6 Gasly +25.0s
2019-04-14T07:14:18Z: Hamilton has rejoined only 1.4s ahead of Leclerc, with Bottas not losing any time to his team-mate but emerging third behind the Ferrari.
2019-04-14T07:13:06Z: Mercedes is going to pit its cars too - both on the same lap!
2019-04-14T07:12:48Z: Vettel is now 10.6s behind third placed Leclerc but will surely quickly catch his team-mate as he has softer and substantially newer tyres.
2019-04-14T07:12:26Z: Vettel rejoins in fourth, safely clear of Verstappen and also now on mediums.
2019-04-14T07:11:49Z: Leclerc is going to move back into third place when Vettel makes this stop, but surely Ferrari will put Leclerc onto a two-stopper now too.
2019-04-14T07:11:26Z: Magnussen pits for a second time and heads onto a new set of mediums. He's back out in 14th.
2019-04-14T07:11:04Z: Verstappen gets out in fifth, just ahead of team-mate Gasly, and is now on medium tyres.
2019-04-14T07:10:46Z: But Red Bull pits Verstappen! He comes in from fourth place before Leclerc can even catch him.
2019-04-14T07:10:22Z: Leclerc is only half a second faster than Verstappen on that lap, but he's under three seconds from the Red Bull's tail now.
2019-04-14T07:09:55Z: Verstappen asks Red Bull if the wind is picking up again, and is told it is. The team had earlier suggested wind wasn't great for its car's handling.
2019-04-14T07:09:30Z: Hamilton has asked Mercedes who has the fastest lap point. Because, blatantly, he'd like it. Right now, it still belongs to Bottas.
2019-04-14T07:07:10Z: Kvyat visits the pits for a stop but has a horrible delay while his Toro Rosso's nose is seen too. He's back out on a shiny set of softs in 18th, ahead only of Kubica.
2019-04-14T07:06:26Z: Up front, Hamilton is now 3.8s clear of Bottas and it's looking pretty static.
2019-04-14T07:06:03Z: Leclerc takes another second out of Verstappen and gets the gap down to 4.4s.
2019-04-14T07:05:11Z: Midfield gaps at the halfway point: 7 Ricciardo; 8 Perez +1.3s; 9 Raikkonen +3.6s; 10 Grosjean +3.5s; 11 Albon +5.5s; 12 Magnussen +1.8s; 13 Stroll 0.7s.
2019-04-14T07:04:38Z: This is how close Vettel and Verstappen got during their earlier battle
2019-04-14T07:03:31Z: Raikkonen comes out on top in an entertaining tussle with Grosjean for ninth. The Alfa driver got up the inside of the Haas at Turn 14 and secured the position into the final corner, although Grosjean briefly retaliated on the run to Turn 1 before settling for ninth.
2019-04-14T07:03:20Z: Lead group gaps on lap 29: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +3.3s; 3 Vettel +11.6s; 4 Verstappen +16.4s; 5 Leclerc +23.1s; 6 Gasly +38.2s
2019-04-14T07:01:10Z: Leclerc carves 0.8s out of the gap to Verstappen on the last lap and is now under 8s behind in his chase of fourth.
2019-04-14T07:00:52Z: Stroll gets Giovinazzi at the same point the following lap to move into 13th. The Alfa driver appears to be struggling badly with his medium tyres now.
2019-04-14T07:00:44Z: Hamilton does his best lap of the race so far and pulls out a 3s lead over Bottas, who still holds the fastest lap bonus at the moment.
2019-04-14T06:59:31Z: Albon completes a DRS-assisted pass on the second Alfa of Giovinazzi at the end of the back straight for 12th. The Toro Rosso is in the hunt for a point from the back of a grid.
2019-04-14T06:58:27Z: At least Leclerc looks like he'll keep us entertained - he takes six tenths out of Verstappen on that lap and is now just under 9s behind the fourth-placed Red Bull.
2019-04-14T06:58:17Z: Raikkonen had been behind Magnussen, too, but quickly dispatches the second Haas out of Turn 6.
2019-04-14T06:57:42Z: Hamilton rebuilds his lead to 1.7s with a quicker lap than Bottas. Which frankly is a bit of a shame as there are 30 laps to go, no more pitstops for the leaders expected, and this is in danger of getting a touch dull up front.
2019-04-14T06:57:23Z: Raikkonen's Alfa Romeo is turned around quicktime, and goes onto the hard tyres for the run to the finish. He's back out in 10th, behind Grosjean.
2019-04-14T06:55:57Z: Leclerc is pushing hard to try to make up for what that strategy has cost him - he's lapping 0.4s quicker than Verstappen as he tries to close the 10s gap to the Red Bull ahead.
2019-04-14T06:54:49Z: Vettel has taken care of the Verstappen threat for now, and pulled 3.5s clear of the Red Bull behind him.
2019-04-14T06:54:24Z: Another new fastest lap from Bottas, a 1m36.558s. He's going to keep Hamilton alert in this stint it seems.
2019-04-14T06:53:05Z: Gasly is tucked up behind Raikkonen on the main straight, and jostles with the Alfa Romeo for a few corners before going deep on the brakes at Turn 6 then cutting back ahead of Raikkonen.
2019-04-14T06:52:24Z: Lead gaps with first pitstops done: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +1.9s; 3 Vettel +7.2s; 4 Verstappen +10.2s; 5 Leclerc +21.1s; 6 Gasly +27.7s. All now on hard tyres.
2019-04-14T06:51:31Z: Leclerc has gone from behind a second behind Vettel to 14s behind Vettel, and has lost fourth place to Verstappen. That really didn't work for Ferrari.
2019-04-14T06:50:57Z: Pitting a lap earlier has helped Bottas - he's now just 1.8s behind leader Hamilton.
2019-04-14T06:50:35Z: Hamilton pits from the lead, and Leclerc comes in from second too.
2019-04-14T06:49:58Z: Apart from the Williams cars, Raikkonen is the last of the midfielders yet to stop. He's sixth at present, ahead of Gasly after the Red Bull's stop.
2019-04-14T06:49:25Z: Bottas has switched to hard tyres (as did Vettel, apologies for misidentifying that earlier) and he rejoins in the gap between Leclerc and Vettel.
2019-04-14T06:48:43Z: Leclerc has to cling to Ferrari's 'this will work out at the end of the race' hope because he's now lapping over 3s slower than Vettel and his fresh tyres.
2019-04-14T06:48:36Z: Short-lived Class B lead for Perez. He pits in the Racing Point, and comes out in a very tidy ninth on hard tyres.
2019-04-14T06:48:10Z: Lap 20 lead gaps: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +5.5s; 3 Leclerc +18.5s; 4 Vettel +33.8s; 5 Verstappen +34.8s
2019-04-14T06:47:46Z: Vettel sets the race's fastest lap so far, a 1m36.998s, but Verstappen is still hanging on with him.
2019-04-14T06:47:14Z: Albon pits for Toro Rosso too, and rejoins in 15th behind Russell (who is yet to stop but has dropped back through the order).
2019-04-14T06:46:59Z: Verstappen was a long way back when he attacked Vettel, that was a beautifully bold move.
2019-04-14T06:46:23Z: Gasly pits, which moves the battling Vettel and Verstappen up to fourth and fifth.
2019-04-14T06:46:06Z: Vettel cuts back to the inside on the exit of the hairpin to retake the place from Verstappen, and then pushes the Red Bull wide onto the grass slightly to ensure he keeps it.
2019-04-14T06:45:40Z: Verstappen gets DRS on Vettel on the back straight... and he launches the Red Bull down the inside into the hairpin!
2019-04-14T06:45:17Z: Ricciardo pits from sixth and rejoins in 11th on hards in his Renault - ahead of Kvyat, Grosjean and Magnussen.
2019-04-14T06:45:16Z: Vettel is up to speed, though, and does the best middle sector of the day so far.
2019-04-14T06:44:53Z: Vettel has stuck with medium tyres for now. He's straight under pressure from Verstappen, who has just set the best first sector of anyone so far.
2019-04-14T06:44:26Z: Vettel rejoins still just in front of Verstappen - can the Red Bull attack on its hotter tyres?
2019-04-14T06:43:49Z: Ferrari does react, bringing in Vettel from third place.
2019-04-14T06:43:34Z: Will Ferrari react to Verstappen's pitstop and bring one of its cars in to fend off any undercut potential?
2019-04-14T06:43:08Z: Verstappen has moved onto hard tyres and he gets out in eighth, just ahead of Raikkonen. Perez isn't far ahead so he won't have clear air for long.
2019-04-14T06:42:31Z: Verstappen comes in - the first of the leaders to stop. He's been right with the Ferraris up to now...
2019-04-14T06:41:21Z: Now it's Leclerc's turn to lock a brake into the hairpin, and that drops him 1.6s behind Vettel.
2019-04-14T06:41:13Z: More frustration for Hulkenberg. He's now behind both Haas drivers, as Magnussen has passed him for 15th.
2019-04-14T06:40:50Z: The amount of lock-ups and wobbles Vettel is having suggests he's not exactly holding back. This looks like his pace - and it's quite a lot slower than the Mercedes and not really any quicker than Leclerc.
2019-04-14T06:39:23Z: Vettel is losing 0.8s-1.0s to leader Hamilton every lap and is now 12s behind, with Leclerc and Verstappen still following him closely.
2019-04-14T06:36:42Z: We're not expecting it to last, but the Williams drivers are perilously close to the points as a result of the early incidents and recent stops. Russell is 12th, seven seconds behind current 10th-place man Stroll, while Kubica was next in the queue but has been passed now by Kvyat, Grosjean and Hulkenberg.
2019-04-14T06:35:55Z: Vettel has another huge lock-up into the hairpin. He was a second slower than Hamilton on that lap and is now 10.5s off the lead.
2019-04-14T06:34:20Z: Lead gaps on lap 12: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +4.1s; 3 Vettel +9.6s; 4 Leclerc +10.7s; 5 Verstappen +13.2s; 6 Gasly +21.2s
2019-04-14T06:34:15Z: A lap after losing a place to Raikkonen, Hulkenberg pits to go onto the hard compound. Renault left that slightly too long, though, as Hulkenberg rejoins behind the lead Haas of Grosjean, who was the first of the  midfielders to stop.
2019-04-14T06:33:53Z: That last lap was a slightly messy one for Vettel and he's lost eight tenths to leader Hamilton.
2019-04-14T06:32:32Z: Vettel has a big lock-up into the hairpin at the end of the long straight. Leclerc is still right behind Vettel...
2019-04-14T06:32:07Z: One correction - Raikkonen is yet to stop in the Alfa Romeo and remains on softs. He's also up to ninth after passing the second Renault of Hulkenberg at the end of the back straight.
2019-04-14T06:31:30Z: So can Vettel now catch the Mercedes? He's 4.5s behind second-placed Bottas and nearly 8s from leader Hamilton.
2019-04-14T06:30:59Z: Despite that protestation, though, Leclerc moves aside and lets Vettel through into third.
2019-04-14T06:30:29Z: Magnussen does the same trick as team-mate Grosjean a lap later, pitting to switch the soft tyre for the hard.
2019-04-14T06:29:33Z: Verstappen is tagging along with the Ferraris, 2.4s behind Vettel in fifth place. The soft-tyre shod second Red Bull of Gasly cannot keep up - he's 7s off Verstappen already.
2019-04-14T06:28:59Z: Vettel is still right on Leclerc's tail in fourth and within DRS range but isn't able to get close enough to pass and doesn't look like he'll be getting any team help to do so.
2019-04-14T06:28:11Z: Hamilton has stretched his lead over Bottas up to 3.2s after eight laps, with Leclerc now 6s off the lead in third.
2019-04-14T06:27:48Z: Giovinazzi comes in for his first stop and switches to the mediums. Kvyat also comes in, but only for his drivethrough.
2019-04-14T06:25:29Z: Kvyat has been given a drivethrough penalty for his incident with the McLarens on the opening lap.
2019-04-14T06:24:17Z: Ricciardo has the 'Class B' lead for Renault in seventh in what has been a far more encouraging weekend for the Renault driver. He's four seconds behind the second Red Bull of Gasly, but ahead of Perez, Hulkenberg and Raikkonen.
2019-04-14T06:22:16Z: Lead gaps on lap four: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +1.8s; 3 Leclerc +4.1s; 4 Vettel +4.8s; 5 Verstappen +7.0s; 6 Gasly +10.5s
2019-04-14T06:21:44Z: Vettel is within DRS range of team-mate Leclerc for third, but so far it's only allowing him to close rather than actually challenge the sister Ferrari.
2019-04-14T06:20:25Z: Hamilton takes an early hold on the fastest lap bonus point with a 1m38.119s. He's 1.5s in front of Bottas.
2019-04-14T06:19:58Z: Talking of splitting team-mates – Raikkonen's in between the Haas drivers now and pressuring Grosjean for 10th.
2019-04-14T06:19:24Z: Meanwhile, inside the top 10, Perez runs eighth after a blinding start that got him in between the two Renaults. He started 12th!
2019-04-14T06:18:56Z: At first glance it looked like Norris ran wide through the slow Turn 6. As he regained the racing line, Kvyat was hit on the left rear by the other McLaren of Sainz just behind. That pitched Kvyat left into Norris, whose car was lifted into the car slightly sideways but thankfully didn't turn into anything more dramatic. Everyone's continued, but the McLarens needed a trip to the pitlane first.
2019-04-14T06:18:30Z: The Mercedes are making a quick break at the front of the field, with Leclerc in third already 3.3s behind leader Hamilton.
2019-04-14T06:17:19Z: Order under VSC: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Leclerc; 4 Vettel; 5 Verstappen; 6 Gasly; 7 Ricciardo; 8 Perez; 9 Hulkenberg; 10 Grosjean; 11 Magnussen; 12 Raikkonen; 13 Stroll; 14 Giovinazzi; 15 Russell; 16 Kubica; 17 Kvyat; 18 Albon; 19 Sainz; 20 Norris
2019-04-14T06:16:34Z: That has triggered a virtual safety car. Time for the marshals to clear up the debris while we take a look at the replay...
2019-04-14T06:15:47Z: Norris hits strife early on! The McLaren was pitched into the air following contact with Kvyat, who had been hit himself.
2019-04-14T06:15:44Z: The 'even' side of the grid worked much better off the line for the lead group, with Hamilton and Leclerc getting better traction than team-mates Bottas and Vettel and then claiming the inside line into Turn 1.
2019-04-14T06:14:13Z: Charles Leclerc gets ahead of Sebastian Vettel into the first corner too, and then Vettel runs a touch wide and comes under pressure from Verstappen.
2019-04-14T06:13:53Z: Hamilton gets the better start and passes Bottas for the lead as the race begins!
2019-04-14T06:13:19Z: Poleman Bottas is lining up ahead of Hamilton as the field comes into place.
2019-04-14T06:12:59Z: Verstappen has made it back to his correct fifth place as the field forms up on the grid.
2019-04-14T06:12:46Z: Robert Kubica also spins in the Williams - tyre warm-up is obviously extremely tricky in the cold conditions.
2019-04-14T06:12:20Z: Max Verstappen has spun his Red Bull on the formation lap!
2019-04-14T06:10:56Z: The field sets off on the formation lap.
2019-04-14T06:05:55Z: It's an all-Mercedes front row at Shanghai, with Bottas leading Hamilton and seeking his fifth win in F1. The Ferraris are just behind, and have a straightline speed advantage (or so we've been repeatedly told...).We'll find out the truth very shortly. If you need a little reminder of how we got here, look no further: Chinese Grand Prix qualifying: Valtteri Bottas leads Mercedes 1-2Valtteri Bottas claimed his first Formula 1 pole position of the 2019 season in qualifying for the Chinese Grand Prix
2019-04-14T06:02:02Z: Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the Chinese Grand Prix. It's an early morning start for our European followers – let's hope we're rewarded with an exciting race!
